titleInfo.title: Letter No. 36: Rawson Hart Boddam, Nathaniel Stockhouse, John Torlesse, Robert Sparks, James Morley, Alexander Callander, John Beaumont and David Carnegie, Council at Bombay Castle, to Edward Galley, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: This letter acknowledges the receipt of Edward Galley's letters of 10 July, 3 September and 18 October 1784, together with a consignment of treasure, which arrived at Bombay via the Scorpion.This acknowledgement is followed by three enclosures: an extract from the Honourable Company's Commands to the Presidency of Bombay (no. 37, dated 16 November 1784), which includes a list of writers appointed for the Presidency; and two extracts from an Act of Parliament (nos. 38 and 39), which obliges British subjects in India to reside within ten miles of a principal settlement.
